Course provided by MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

You will know about: what is coaching, its types, components, rules; skills and competencies of coaches, how to proceed a coaching session and coaching methods and tools. After finishing a course you will get: key knowledge about coaching and how to implement it in effective ways


The Crucial Role of Coaching Techniques in Managerial Leadership and Career Development

The role of a manager goes far beyond traditional tasks of overseeing operations and ensuring productivity. A successful manager is now expected to act as a leader, a mentor, and a coach, guiding their team members towards individual and collective success. This paradigm shift highlights the significance of coaching techniques in the realm of managerial responsibilities.


The Transformation of Managerial Roles

Evolving Leadership Expectations

The traditional image of a manager as a stern authority figure has given way to a more holistic view of leadership. Managers are now expected to serve as role models, motivators, and mentors to their teams. This shift stems from the recognition that employees perform at their best when they feel valued, supported, and empowered.

The evolution of leadership expectations can be traced back to the changing dynamics of the modern workplace. In the past, managers were primarily responsible for enforcing rules and ensuring productivity. However, as organizations began to realize that employee engagement and satisfaction were crucial for success, a transformation in managerial roles ensued.

Today, managers are not just tasked with overseeing tasks and projects; they are expected to inspire and empower their teams. This shift is partly a response to the changing nature of work itself. In a knowledge-based economy, where creativity, innovation, and adaptability are paramount, traditional top-down management no longer suffices.


Coaching as a Leadership Skill

Coaching has emerged as a pivotal leadership skill that fosters personal and professional growth. We'll explore how coaching techniques, such as active listening, constructive feedback, and goal-setting, can empower managers to become effective leaders who inspire and guide their teams towards excellence.

Coaching is not a one-size-fits-all approach; it is a dynamic and personalized method of leadership. Effective coaches adapt their style to the needs and preferences of individual team members. They actively listen to understand the unique challenges and aspirations of each employee, fostering a sense of trust and rapport.

Moreover, coaching is not merely about providing solutions but guiding employees to discover answers themselves. This approach instills a sense of ownership and accountability in team members. It encourages them to take the initiative, think critically, and develop problem-solving skills—a valuable asset in today's fast-paced, ever-changing business landscape.

Coaching also plays a crucial role in setting and achieving goals. Effective managers use coaching techniques to collaboratively define clear, actionable objectives with their team members. This process not only aligns individual efforts with organizational goals but also empowers employees to track their progress and make necessary adjustments along the way.


Coaching Knowledge for Career Development

Career Development in the Modern Workplace

Career development is a top priority for employees. Discover how coaching knowledge equips managers with the tools to help team members navigate their career paths, set meaningful goals, and continually improve their skills.

Career development has evolved from being a peripheral concern to a central focus in the modern workplace. In an era marked by rapid technological advancements and industry disruptions, employees recognize the importance of continuous learning and skill enhancement to remain relevant and competitive.

This heightened emphasis on career development places managers at the forefront of helping their team members chart their professional journeys. Coaching knowledge equips managers with the ability to provide guidance that is not only aligned with the organization's needs but also tailored to the aspirations of individual employees.

One of the key advantages of coaching in career development is its ability to facilitate self-awareness. Effective coaches help employees identify their strengths, weaknesses, interests, and values. Armed with this self-knowledge, employees can make informed career decisions that align with their passions and long-term goals.


The Manager as a Career Development Partner

Explore the responsibilities of middle and top managers in preparing and mentoring personal development plans for their team members. Learn how these plans can align with organizational objectives and create a win-win situation for both employees and the company.

Managers who actively engage in career development become indispensable partners in their employees' professional growth. They play a pivotal role in creating personalized development plans that leverage individual strengths and address areas needing improvement.

These development plans not only benefit the employees but also the organization. By aligning individual development goals with the company's strategic objectives, managers ensure that every team member's growth contributes to the overall success of the business.

Furthermore, coaching techniques are instrumental in fostering a growth mindset within teams. Managers can use coaching to encourage employees to embrace challenges, persist in the face of setbacks, and view failures as opportunities for learning and improvement. This mindset shift has a profound impact on team performance and innovation.


Coaching for Internal Education and Employee Development

The Role of Managers in Internal Education

Managers often bear the responsibility of nurturing a culture of learning within their teams and organizations. Explore how coaching methods can be instrumental in identifying and addressing skill gaps, fostering innovation, and supporting ongoing employee development.

Organizations that prioritize learning and development gain a competitive edge. Managers are at the forefront of this initiative, serving as the catalysts for continuous improvement and innovation within their teams.

Coaching methods play a pivotal role in identifying and addressing skill gaps. By regularly assessing the competencies of their team members, managers can tailor training and development programs to bridge these gaps effectively. This proactive approach not only enhances individual skills but also bolsters the organization's overall capabilities.

Moreover, coaching encourages a culture of innovation. Effective coaches inspire creativity and critical thinking in their teams. They challenge employees to question the status quo, explore new ideas, and experiment with novel approaches. In this way, managers act as innovation champions, driving progress and adaptability.


Coaching as a Tool for Employee Empowerment

Employee empowerment is a cornerstone of effective leadership. Coaching techniques provide managers with the tools to empower their team members by fostering a sense of ownership and autonomy in their roles.

One of the primary ways coaching empowers employees is by promoting self-directed learning. Instead of relying solely on formal training programs, employees learn to identify their development needs and take initiative in seeking resources and opportunities for growth. Managers who coach effectively encourage this proactive approach.

Furthermore, coaching cultivates a growth-oriented mindset among employees. When team members receive regular feedback, both positive and constructive, they become more receptive to continuous improvement. They view challenges as opportunities for growth and development, which ultimately leads to higher levels of engagement and performance.

By creating an environment where continuous learning is celebrated, managers inspire their teams to thrive in an ever-changing business landscape. This culture of learning becomes a strategic advantage for organizations, as it enables them to adapt quickly to new challenges and opportunities.


Coaching for Mental Health and Well-being

The Manager as a Trusted Support System

For many employees, especially those who live alone or lack a strong support network, a manager can become their most trusted confidant. Understand how coaching methods extend beyond professional development to support the mental health and well-being of team members.

The relationship between a manager and their team members extends beyond the confines of the workplace. In some cases, a manager may be the primary source of support for an employee, especially when they are facing personal challenges or seeking guidance related to their mental health and well-being.

Coaching methods are not limited to career development; they encompass the whole spectrum of an employee's life. Effective managers create an environment where team members feel comfortable discussing personal challenges and seeking guidance when needed. This trust and openness are essential for maintaining employee well-being.

In situations where employees are dealing with stress, anxiety, or other mental health issues, managers with coaching skills can provide valuable support. They can listen empathetically, offer guidance on stress management techniques, and help employees access appropriate resources for professional help when necessary.


Coaching for Life Questions and Personal Challenges

Life is filled with complexities, and employees often grapple with personal challenges that can affect their work performance and overall well-being. Managers who are skilled in coaching can offer valuable guidance during these times of need.

One area where coaching is particularly beneficial is work-life balance. In today's fast-paced world, employees often struggle to juggle their professional and personal responsibilities. Managers can use coaching techniques to help team members set boundaries, manage their time effectively, and achieve a healthier work-life balance.

Coaching also proves invaluable in navigating interpersonal relationships, both within and outside the workplace. Managers can offer insights into effective communication, conflict resolution, and building positive relationships, which can significantly impact an employee's overall quality of life.

In times of personal crisis or uncertainty, such as major life transitions or unexpected challenges, employees may turn to their managers for guidance. Managers trained in coaching can provide a supportive and non-judgmental space for employees to explore their feelings, identify potential solutions, and develop action plans to address these challenges.


In conclusion, coaching techniques have become indispensable in the modern workplace, particularly within the roles of managers and leaders. These skills not only drive career development and internal education but also play a crucial role in supporting the mental health and well-being of employees.

As we navigate an ever-changing professional landscape, organizations that recognize the importance of coaching will not only foster a culture of continuous improvement but also cultivate a loyal and motivated workforce. Managers who embrace coaching as a core aspect of their leadership style will not only elevate their own careers but also become catalysts for the success of their teams and organizations as a whole.

By understanding and implementing coaching techniques effectively, managers can truly transform the workplace into an environment where individuals thrive, careers flourish, and holistic well-being is nurtured.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build the career at management, coaching, mentorship or get to know themselves better, for people working in helping areas, for coaches.

It encourages them to take the initiative, think critically, and develop problem-solving skills—a valuable asset in today's fast-paced, ever-changing business landscape.  Coaching also plays a crucial role in setting and achieving goals. Effective managers use coaching techniques to collaboratively define clear, actionable objectives with their team members. This process not only aligns individual efforts with organizational goals but also empowers employees to track their progress and make necessary adjustments along the way.

Coaching Knowledge for Career Development  Career Development in the Modern Workplace  Career development is a top priority for employees. Discover how coaching knowledge equips managers with the tools to help team members navigate their career paths, set meaningful goals, and continually improve their skills.  Career development has evolved from being a peripheral concern to a central focus in the modern workplace. In an era marked by rapid technological advancements and industry disruptions, employees recognize the importance of continuous learning and skill enhancement to remain relevant and competitive.  This heightened emphasis on career development places managers at the forefront of helping their team members chart their professional journeys. Coaching knowledge equips managers with the ability to provide guidance that is not only aligned with the organization's needs but also tailored to the aspirations of individual employees.  One of the key advantages of coaching in career development is its ability to facilitate self-awareness. Effective coaches help employees identify their strengths, weaknesses, interests, and values. Armed with this self-knowledge, employees can make informed career decisions that align with their passions and long-term goals.

The Manager as a Career Development Partner  Explore the responsibilities of middle and top managers in preparing and mentoring personal development plans for their team members. Learn how these plans can align with organizational objectives and create a win-win situation for both employees and the company.  Managers who actively engage in career development become indispensable partners in their employees' professional growth. They play a pivotal role in creating personalized development plans that leverage individual strengths and address areas needing improvement.  These development plans not only benefit the employees but also the organization. By aligning individual development goals with the company's strategic objectives, managers ensure that every team member's growth contributes to the overall success of the business.  Furthermore, coaching techniques are instrumental in fostering a growth mindset within teams. Managers can use coaching to encourage employees to embrace challenges, persist in the face of setbacks, and view failures as opportunities for learning and improvement. This mindset shift has a profound impact on team performance and innovation.

Coaching for Internal Education and Employee Development  The Role of Managers in Internal Education  Managers often bear the responsibility of nurturing a culture of learning within their teams and organizations. Explore how coaching methods can be instrumental in identifying and addressing skill gaps, fostering innovation, and supporting ongoing employee development.  Organizations that prioritize learning and development gain a competitive edge. Managers are at the forefront of this initiative, serving as the catalysts for continuous improvement and innovation within their teams.  Coaching methods play a pivotal role in identifying and addressing skill gaps. By regularly assessing the competencies of their team members, managers can tailor training and development programs to bridge these gaps effectively. This proactive approach not only enhances individual skills but also bolsters the organization's overall capabilities.  Moreover, coaching encourages a culture of innovation. Effective coaches inspire creativity and critical thinking in their teams. They challenge employees to question the status quo, explore new ideas, and experiment with novel approaches. In this way, managers act as innovation champions, driving progress and adaptability.

Coaching as a Tool for Employee Empowerment  Employee empowerment is a cornerstone of effective leadership. Coaching techniques provide managers with the tools to empower their team members by fostering a sense of ownership and autonomy in their roles.  One of the primary ways coaching empowers employees is by promoting self-directed learning. Instead of relying solely on formal training programs, employees learn to identify their development needs and take initiative in seeking resources and opportunities for growth. Managers who coach effectively encourage this proactive approach.  Furthermore, coaching cultivates a growth-oriented mindset among employees. When team members receive regular feedback, both positive and constructive, they become more receptive to continuous improvement. They view challenges as opportunities for growth and development, which ultimately leads to higher levels of engagement and performance.  By creating an environment where continuous learning is celebrated, managers inspire their teams to thrive in an ever-changing business landscape. This culture of learning becomes a strategic advantage for organizations, as it enables them to adapt quickly to new challenges and opportunities.

Coaching for Mental Health and Well-being  The Manager as a Trusted Support System  For many employees, especially those who live alone or lack a strong support network, a manager can become their most trusted confidant. Understand how coaching methods extend beyond professional development to support the mental health and well-being of team members.  The relationship between a manager and their team members extends beyond the confines of the workplace. In some cases, a manager may be the primary source of support for an employee, especially when they are facing personal challenges or seeking guidance related to their mental health and well-being.  Coaching methods are not limited to career development; they encompass the whole spectrum of an employee's life. Effective managers create an environment where team members feel comfortable discussing personal challenges and seeking guidance when needed. This trust and openness are essential for maintaining employee well-being.  In situations where employees are dealing with stress, anxiety, or other mental health issues, managers with coaching skills can provide valuable support. They can listen empathetically, offer guidance on stress management techniques, and help employees access appropriate resources for professional help when necessary.

Coaching for Life Questions and Personal Challenges  Life is filled with complexities, and employees often grapple with personal challenges that can affect their work performance and overall well-being. Managers who are skilled in coaching can offer valuable guidance during these times of need.  One area where coaching is particularly beneficial is work-life balance. In today's fast-paced world, employees often struggle to juggle their professional and personal responsibilities. Managers can use coaching techniques to help team members set boundaries, manage their time effectively, and achieve a healthier work-life balance.  Coaching also proves invaluable in navigating interpersonal relationships, both within and outside the workplace. Managers can offer insights into effective communication, conflict resolution, and building positive relationships, which can significantly impact an employee's overall quality of life.  In times of personal crisis or uncertainty, such as major life transitions or unexpected challenges, employees may turn to their managers for guidance. Managers trained in coaching can provide a supportive and non-judgmental space for employees to explore their feelings, identify potential solutions, and develop action plans to address these challenges.

Coaching techniques have become indispensable in the modern workplace, particularly within the roles of managers and leaders. These skills not only drive career development and internal education but also play a crucial role in supporting the mental health and well-being of employees.  As we navigate an ever-changing professional landscape, organizations that recognize the importance of coaching will not only foster a culture of continuous improvement but also cultivate a loyal and motivated workforce. Managers who embrace coaching as a core aspect of their leadership style will not only elevate their own careers but also become catalysts for the success of their teams and organizations as a whole.  By understanding and implementing coaching techniques effectively, managers can truly transform the workplace into an environment where individuals thrive, careers flourish, and holistic well-being is nurtured.

Operations management (OM) is the administration of business practices to create the highest level of efficiency possible within an organization. It is concerned with converting materials and labor into goods and services as efficiently as possible to maximize the profit of an organization. OM covers all aspects of a business, from the design and management of products, services, and processes, to the management of supply chains and logistics.


Importance of Operations Management Skills for Career and Business:

Developing skills in operations management can significantly benefit your career and entrepreneurial endeavors in the following ways:

Career:

  • Enhanced Employability: Operations management skills are highly sought after in various industries, including manufacturing, healthcare, technology, retail, and service sectors. Expertise in OM can open up a wide range of career opportunities, such as operations manager, supply chain analyst, production planner, quality manager, project manager, and more.

  • Increased Earning Potential: Professionals with strong operations management skills often command higher salaries due to their ability to optimize processes, reduce costs, improve efficiency, and drive overall business success.

  • Problem-Solving and Decision-Making Abilities: Operations management equips you with the skills to analyze complex problems, identify bottlenecks, and make data-driven decisions that lead to improved operational performance. These skills are valuable assets for any career path.


Business management is the process of planning, organizing, directing, and controlling the resources (financial, human, and material) within an organization to achieve its goals and objectives effectively and efficiently. It encompasses a wide range of activities, from setting strategic direction and making operational decisions to managing resources and leading people.


Importance of Learning Linked Topics:

  • Business Models and Value Propositions: Understanding how businesses create, deliver, and capture value is crucial for identifying opportunities, developing new products or services, and ensuring long-term sustainability.

  • Strategic Management and Planning: This involves setting long-term goals, analyzing the competitive environment, and developing strategies to achieve success. Strong strategic thinking is essential for making informed decisions and guiding the organization towards its vision.

  • Organizational Behavior and Leadership: Effective leaders understand how to motivate and inspire teams, manage conflict, and create a positive work environment. Knowledge of organizational behavior is key to building high-performing teams and fostering a culture of innovation.

  • Risk Management and Business Continuity Planning: Businesses face a variety of risks, from financial and operational disruptions to natural disasters. Risk management involves identifying potential threats, assessing their impact, and implementing strategies to mitigate or avoid them. Business continuity planning ensures that critical operations can continue in the event of a disruption.

  • Change Management and Organizational Development: Organizations must continuously adapt to remain competitive. Change management skills are essential for leading and managing change initiatives effectively, while organizational development focuses on improving the overall performance and effectiveness of the organization.

  • Corporate Governance and Compliance: This involves ensuring that the organization operates ethically, transparently, and in accordance with relevant laws and regulations. Strong corporate governance practices build trust with stakeholders and protect the organization's reputation.


By developing a comprehensive understanding of business management and related topics, you'll gain the knowledge and skills necessary to build a successful career, make a positive impact, and contribute to the growth and development of your organization.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in business

Public Relations  is a strategic communication process that organizations, individuals, or brands use to build and maintain positive relationships with their target audience, stakeholders, and the public. The goal of PR is to create a favorable image, enhance reputation, and manage perceptions through various communication channels.

PR Management involves planning, executing, and monitoring communication strategies to achieve specific objectives, such as promoting a product, managing a crisis, or building brand awareness. It encompasses activities like media relations, event planning, social media management, and crisis communication.

Learning about PR is crucial for companies and managers for several reasons:

  1. Building and Maintaining Reputation: A positive public image is essential for the success of any organization. PR helps in shaping public perception and building a strong, favorable reputation.

  2. Effective Communication: PR teaches effective communication strategies that allow organizations to convey their messages clearly and persuasively, fostering understanding and positive relationships with the audience.

  3. Crisis Management: In times of crisis, effective PR can help minimize damage to a company's reputation. Understanding how to handle and communicate during crises is a vital skill for managers.

  4. Media Relations: PR equips managers with the skills to interact with the media, ensuring that their messages are accurately portrayed in news outlets and other public platforms.

  5. Brand Building: PR plays a significant role in brand building by creating and maintaining a consistent brand image. It helps in differentiating a company or product in a competitive market.

  6. Stakeholder Engagement: Understanding PR is crucial for engaging with various stakeholders, including customers, employees, investors, and the community. It fosters positive relationships and loyalty.

For managers in different domains, PR knowledge supports career development by:

  1. Enhancing Leadership Skills: PR skills contribute to effective leadership by providing managers with the ability to inspire and motivate teams, especially during challenging times.

  2. Building Relationships: PR fosters relationship-building skills, which are essential in managerial roles for collaborating with internal teams, external partners, and stakeholders.

  3. Strategic Decision-Making: PR knowledge enables managers to make informed and strategic decisions regarding communication, marketing, and overall organizational strategy.

  4. Adaptability: In a dynamic business environment, PR skills help managers adapt to changing circumstances, especially in the face of crises or challenges.

  5. Career Advancement: Managers with PR expertise are often better positioned for career advancement, as they can contribute to the overall success and positive image of the organizations they work for.

In summary, learning about PR is crucial for companies and managers as it helps in building and maintaining a positive public image, fostering effective communication, managing crises, and supporting overall career development in various domains.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to build a career at public relations, advertising, marketing, management, SMM, also for the ones who want to improve their business.

Customer experience (CX) is the overall impression customers have of your brand throughout their interactions with your business. It encompasses everything from the initial marketing message to the post-purchase support they receive. Think of it as the customer journey, and CX is all the touchpoints along the way that shape their perception.


Key Areas of CX

  • Customer touchpoints: Every interaction a customer has with your brand, like websites, social media, advertising, in-store experience, and customer service.

  • Customer journey: Mapping out the steps a customer takes to interact with your brand, from awareness to purchase and beyond.

  • Customer satisfaction: How happy customers are with your product or service.

  • Customer loyalty: How likely customers are to return and recommend your brand to others.


CX Frameworks

Frameworks provide a structured approach to improving CX. Here are two common ones:

  • Customer Experience Journey Map: A visual representation of the customer journey, identifying touchpoints and opportunities for improvement.

  • Five Service Dimensions: A framework that focuses on five key aspects of service quality: reliability, responsiveness, assurance, empathy, and tangibles.


Why Learning CXM is Important for Companies:

  1. Improved Customer Satisfaction and Loyalty: CXM focuses on understanding and meeting customer needs, leading to increased satisfaction and a higher likelihood of repeat business.

  2. Enhanced Brand Reputation: Positive customer experiences contribute to a strong brand reputation, attracting new customers and retaining existing ones.

  3. Increased Revenue and Profitability: Satisfied customers are more likely to spend more, refer others, and remain loyal, all of which contribute to revenue growth.

  4. Competitive Advantage: In today's crowded marketplace, exceptional customer experience can be a key differentiator, setting a company apart from its competitors.

  5. Reduced Costs: Resolving customer issues proactively and efficiently can reduce the cost of customer service and support.


Why Learning CXM is Important for Building a Career as a Manager:

  1. In-demand Skill: CXM is a highly sought-after skill in today's business world, as companies increasingly recognize its importance.

  2. Career Advancement: Expertise in CXM can open doors to various managerial roles, such as Customer Experience Manager, Customer Success Manager, or Marketing Manager.

  3. Problem-solving Skills: CXM involves identifying and addressing customer pain points, which enhances problem-solving and analytical skills.

  4. Leadership Development: Managing customer experience initiatives requires strong leadership, communication, and collaboration skills.

  5. Cross-functional Collaboration: CXM often involves working with multiple departments, providing managers with exposure to different areas of the business.


Overall, learning CXM is crucial for companies looking to thrive in the modern business landscape. It's also a valuable investment for managers aiming to build a successful career in various industries.


Importance of Education in Digital Transformation for Companies and Managers:

In the  business environment, digital transformation has emerged as a key driver of competitive advantage and long-term success. Embracing digital technologies is no longer an option but a necessity for companies to remain relevant and thrive. However, implementing digital transformation initiatives requires more than just adopting new tools; it demands a comprehensive understanding of digital trends, customer behavior, data analytics, and organizational change management. This education helps companies and managers:


Strategic Adaptation: Digital transformation education empowers organizations to align their strategies with the opportunities and challenges presented by the digital age. It helps leaders identify potential areas for disruption and develop agile responses to stay ahead of the competition.


Enhanced Customer Experience: Understanding digital transformation enables businesses to design and deliver exceptional customer experiences, which are crucial for customer retention and loyalty in today's customer-centric market.


Data-Driven Decision Making: The course equips managers with skills in data analysis and interpretation, enabling them to make data-driven decisions that lead to improved business outcomes.


Innovation and Creativity: Participants will learn about emerging technologies and innovation processes, fostering a culture of creativity within their organizations and driving continuous improvement.


Organizational Resilience: With digital transformation education, managers can build resilient organizations capable of adapting to disruptions and thriving in times of uncertainty.

courseDetails.title: Professional Certificate in Career Coaching
courseDetails.shortDescription: Professional Certificate in Career Coaching by MTF Institute
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to course: Professional Certificate in Career Coaching by MTF Institute


Course provided by MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

MTF is the official partner of: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

MTF is present in 208 countries and has been chosen by more than 400 000 students.


What is Career Coaching?

Career coaching is a collaborative process between a coach and a client (the coachee). The coach helps the client gain clarity and strategize to achieve their professional goals. This might involve anything from making a major career transition to navigating challenges in their current role


Main Areas of Career Coaching

Career coaching covers a wide range of focus areas. Some of the most common include:

  • Career Exploration: Helping clients define their strengths, interests, and ideal work environments.

  • Goal Setting: Working with clients to set actionable and achievable career goals.

  • Job Search Strategies: Creating effective resumes, cover letters, and improving interviewing skills.

  • Networking and Branding: Building professional networks and developing a strong personal brand.

  • Negotiation Skills: Coaching clients on how to negotiate salary, benefits, and promotions.

  • Leadership Development: Helping those looking to advance into leadership roles grow the necessary skills

  • Performance Enhancement: Identifying areas for improvement and providing strategies to excel in a current role.


How Career Coaching Skills Benefit Clients and Your Own Career

The skills involved in career coaching offer multi-faceted benefits:


Benefits for Consulting Practice

  • Enhanced Client Understanding: Develops deep skills for understanding client needs, goals, and challenges.

  • Goal-Oriented Communication: Provides frameworks for setting clear expectations and tracking progress.

  • Empowerment Strategies: Teaches how to empower clients to take ownership over their careers.

  • Diverse Toolkit: Develops skills like active listening, feedback, and motivational techniques – highly transferable in various consulting fields.

Benefits for Your Own Career Development

  • Self-Awareness: The process forces you to reflect on your own career journey, values, goals, and areas for development.

  • Proactive Mindset: Encouraging clients to take charge translates into your own approach, leading to greater career ownership.

  • Network Expansion: Increases exposure to professionals in various industries, broadening your network and potential opportunities.

  • Growth Mentality: Fosters a focus on continuous learning essential for success in any field.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any who want to work as career coach, build a career or improve their knowledge.

courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to Program: Executive Certificate in Marketing & Customer Experience Management Excellence


Course provided by MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

MTF is the official partner of: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

MTF is present in 215 countries and has been chosen by more than 604 000 students.


Course Author:

Dr. Alex Amoroso is a seasoned professional with a rich background in academia and industry, specializing in research methodologies, strategy formulation, and product development. With a Doctorate Degree from the School of Social Sciences and Politics in Lisbon, Portugal, where she was awarded distinction and honour for her exemplary research, Alex Amoroso brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise to the table.

In addition to her doctoral studies, Ms. Amoroso has served as an invited teacher, delivering courses on to wide range of students from undergraduate level to business students of professional and executives courses. Currently, at EIMT in Zurich, Switzerland, she lectures for doctoral students, offering advanced instruction in research design and methodologies, and in MTF Institute Ms. Amoroso is leading Product Development academical domain.

In synergy between academical and business experience, Ms. Amoroso achieved high results in business career, leading R&D activities, product development, strategic development, market analysis activities in wide range of companies. She implemented the best market practices in industries from Banking and Finance, to PropTech, Consulting and Research, and Innovative Startups.

Alex Amoroso's extensive scientific production includes numerous published articles in reputable journals, as well as oral presentations and posters at international conferences. Her research findings have been presented at esteemed institutions such as the School of Political and Social Sciences and the Stressed Out Conference at UCL, among others.

With a passion for interdisciplinary collaboration and a commitment to driving positive change, Alex Amoroso is dedicated to empowering learners and professionals for usage of cutting edge methodologies for achieving of excellence in global business world.


Customer experience (CX) is the overall impression customers have of your brand throughout their interactions with your business. It encompasses everything from the initial marketing message to the post-purchase support they receive. Think of it as the customer journey, and CX is all the touchpoints along the way that shape their perception.


Key Areas of CX

  • Customer touchpoints: Every interaction a customer has with your brand, like websites, social media, advertising, in-store experience, and customer service.

  • Customer journey: Mapping out the steps a customer takes to interact with your brand, from awareness to purchase and beyond.

  • Customer satisfaction: How happy customers are with your product or service.

  • Customer loyalty: How likely customers are to return and recommend your brand to others.


CX Frameworks

Frameworks provide a structured approach to improving CX. Here are two common ones:

  • Customer Experience Journey Map: A visual representation of the customer journey, identifying touchpoints and opportunities for improvement.

  • Five Service Dimensions: A framework that focuses on five key aspects of service quality: reliability, responsiveness, assurance, empathy, and tangibles.


Why Learning CXM is Important for Companies:

  1. Improved Customer Satisfaction and Loyalty: CXM focuses on understanding and meeting customer needs, leading to increased satisfaction and a higher likelihood of repeat business.

  2. Enhanced Brand Reputation: Positive customer experiences contribute to a strong brand reputation, attracting new customers and retaining existing ones.

  3. Increased Revenue and Profitability: Satisfied customers are more likely to spend more, refer others, and remain loyal, all of which contribute to revenue growth.

  4. Competitive Advantage: In today's crowded marketplace, exceptional customer experience can be a key differentiator, setting a company apart from its competitors.

  5. Reduced Costs: Resolving customer issues proactively and efficiently can reduce the cost of customer service and support.


Why Learning CXM is Important for Building a Career as a Manager:

  1. In-demand Skill: CXM is a highly sought-after skill in today's business world, as companies increasingly recognize its importance.

  2. Career Advancement: Expertise in CXM can open doors to various managerial roles, such as Customer Experience Manager, Customer Success Manager, or Marketing Manager.

  3. Problem-solving Skills: CXM involves identifying and addressing customer pain points, which enhances problem-solving and analytical skills.

  4. Leadership Development: Managing customer experience initiatives requires strong leadership, communication, and collaboration skills.

  5. Cross-functional Collaboration: CXM often involves working with multiple departments, providing managers with exposure to different areas of the business.


Overall, learning CXM is crucial for companies looking to thrive in the modern business landscape. It's also a valuable investment for managers aiming to build a successful career in various industries.


What is Marketing?

  • Definition: Marketing is the process of identifying customer needs, creating products or services that fulfill those needs, and communicating the value of those offerings to potential customers.

  • Focus: Marketing focuses on getting the right message to the right audience, ultimately driving interest and sales.

  • Key Activities:

    • Market research

    • Product development

    • Brand building

    • Advertising and promotions

    • Content creation

    • Customer relationship management


What is Marketing Management?

  • Definition: Marketing management is the strategic and operational process of planning, organizing, implementing, and controlling an organization's marketing resources and activities.

  • Focus: Marketing management aims to create a cohesive marketing plan, optimize resource allocation, and measure the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.

  • Key Activities:

    • Developing marketing strategies and plans

    • Setting marketing budgets

    • Managing marketing teams

    • Overseeing marketing campaigns

    • Analyzing marketing performance (tracking metrics and ROI)

    • Making adjustments to strategies as needed


The Relationship Between Marketing and Marketing Management

Think of marketing as the actions you take to promote your business, and marketing management as the overarching system to plan, execute, and refine those actions strategically.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in marketing and business

courseDetails.title: Gestão de Empresas e Empreendedorismo
courseDetails.shortDescription: Geração de Ideias, Planeamento Empresarial, Financiar o seu Negócio, Considerações Jurídicas, Marketing e Vendas
courseDetails.longDescription:
Bem-vindo ao programa: Programa Avançado em Negócios e Empreendedorismo


Curso ministrado pelo MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

O MTF é o instituto global de educação e pesquisa com sede em Lisboa, Portugal, focado em educação híbrida (presencial e online) para negócios e profissionais nas áreas: Negócios e Administração, Ciência e Tecnologia, Banca e Finanças.

O centro de P&D do MTF concentra-se em atividades de pesquisa nas áreas: Inteligência Artificial, Machine Learning, Ciência de Dados, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Criptomoedas e Ativos Digitais, Metaversos, Transformação Digital, Fintech, Comércio Eletrónico, Internet das Coisas.

O MTF é parceiro oficial da: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, membro da Câmara de Comércio e Indústria Portuguesa.

O MTF está presente em 215 países e já foi escolhido por mais de 560 000 alunos.


Autor do Curso: O Dr. João Martins é um gestor e empreendedor experiente, com mais de 30 anos de experiência em cargos de alta gestão nos setores de telecomunicações e TI. Começando num ambiente académico, onde obteve o seu doutoramento em Engenharia e um MBA na Universidade Nova de Lisboa, evoluiu rapidamente para cargos de C-suite no ambiente corporativo, tanto em grandes empresas como em startups. Atualmente é administrador e acionista de uma startup integradora de TI em Lisboa, focada em cibersegurança. Apaixonado por educação, é também Professor convidado na Nova Information Management School, lecionando Gestão do Conhecimento e Análise Financeira a alunos de pós-graduação e graduação.


O curso "Introdução ao Empreendedorismo" é projetado para permitir uma compreensão básica do empreendedorismo, a sua importância na economia moderna e as skills essenciais necessárias para ter sucesso como empreendedor.

Ao longo do curso, os alunos irão explorar vários aspetos do empreendedorismo, incluindo geração de ideias, planeamento de negócios, financiamento, marketing e operações.

O curso também aprofunda as características que definem empreendedores de sucesso e as diferenças entre empreendedorismo e propriedade de pequenas empresas.

Serão utilizados estudos de caso reais para ilustrar a aplicação destes conceitos em cenários práticos.

No final do curso, os alunos terão uma compreensão abrangente do que é necessário para iniciar e crescer um negócio de sucesso e estarão equipados com o conhecimento para navegar nos desafios do empreendedorismo.


Empreendedorismo é o processo de identificar oportunidades, inovar e assumir riscos para criar e gerir um empreendimento comercial. Envolve a vontade de suportar a incerteza e a capacidade de adaptação a circunstâncias em mudança para alcançar o sucesso. Empreendedores são indivíduos que embarcam nesta jornada, utilizando a sua criatividade, visão e determinação para dar vida às suas ideias. Existem várias razões principais pelas quais os indivíduos optam por se tornar empreendedores e construir os seus próprios negócios:


Busca pela Paixão: Muitos empreendedores são movidos pela paixão por uma determinada ideia, produto ou serviço. Eles querem concretizar a sua visão e causar um impacto significativo na sua área de atuação.

  • Independência Financeira: Construir um negócio de sucesso pode proporcionar liberdade e independência financeira. Os empreendedores têm a oportunidade de criar riqueza para si e para as suas famílias, capitalizando as suas próprias ideias e trabalho árduo.

  • Flexibilidade e Autonomia: O empreendedorismo oferece a flexibilidade de definir o seu próprio horário e trabalhar em projetos que se alinhem com os seus valores e objetivos pessoais. Os empreendedores têm autonomia para tomar decisões e moldar a direção dos seus negócios como acharem melhor.

  • Desejo de Inovação: O empreendedorismo é frequentemente impulsionado pelo desejo de inovar e criar algo novo. Os empreendedores procuram resolver problemas, revolucionar indústrias e apresentar soluções inovadoras que melhorem a vida das pessoas.

  • Crescimento Pessoal e Realização: Construir um negócio pode ser uma experiência profundamente gratificante que promove o crescimento pessoal e a realização. Os empreendedores enfrentam desafios, superam obstáculos e aprendem lições valiosas ao longo do caminho, o que pode levar a uma sensação de realização e satisfação.


Aprender sobre negócios pode fornecer conhecimentos e habilidades essenciais que apoiam o processo de construção de uma carreira e lançamento de uma startup. Algumas maneiras pelas quais aprender sobre negócios pode ser benéfico incluem:


Compreender a Dinâmica do Mercado: Uma sólida compreensão dos princípios de negócios pode ajudar os empreendedores a identificar oportunidades de mercado, avaliar a procura pelos seus produtos ou serviços e desenvolver estratégias eficazes para alcançar o seu público-alvo.

Gestão Financeira: Aprender sobre finanças e contabilidade é crucial para gerir os aspetos financeiros de um negócio, incluindo orçamento, previsão e gestão de fluxo de caixa. Esse conhecimento é essencial para tomar decisões informadas e garantir a saúde financeira de uma startup.

Marketing e Vendas: Estratégias eficazes de marketing e vendas são essenciais para atrair clientes e fazer crescer um negócio. Aprender sobre princípios de marketing, branding e aquisição de clientes pode ajudar os empreendedores a desenvolver estratégias para promover eficazmente os seus produtos ou serviços e impulsionar as vendas.

Liderança e Gestão: Aprender sobre os princípios de liderança e gestão pode ajudar os empreendedores a construir e liderar equipas de alto desempenho, delegar tarefas de forma eficaz e criar uma cultura de trabalho positiva dentro das suas organizações. No geral, aprender sobre negócios pode fornecer aos empreendedores o conhecimento, as habilidades e a confiança de que precisam para navegar pelos desafios do empreendedorismo, construir negócios de sucesso e atingir os seus objetivos.
targetAudiences: Sem requisitos especiais. Um curso para qualquer pessoa que queira construir uma carreira em Gestão

Introduction to the Program Management Program

The course introduces program management, highlighting its strategic role in managing related projects to achieve broader organizational goals. The session is divided into four stages:


  1. What is Program Management

  2. The Role of a Program Manager

  3. Understanding Projects – key stages, artifacts, documents, meetings, and activities.

  4. Program Management Methodologies – including benefits and challenges.


Key Concepts and Insights

What is Program Management?

  • Definition: Coordinated management of related projects for strategic alignment and value delivery.

  • Focuses on improving organizational performance, managing interdependencies, and delivering consolidated benefits.


The Role of a Program Manager

  • Operates at a strategic level to align projects with organizational objectives.

  • Distinct from a project manager, focusing on coordination, strategic outcomes, and long-term benefits.

  • Responsibilities include program planning, resource allocation, governance, and change management.


Strategic Program Alignment

  • Ensures programs contribute to organizational strategy through proper planning and alignment.

  • Involves stakeholder engagement, governance, and risk management.


Program Lifecycle Management

  • Phases include:

    • Initiation: Defining vision, stakeholders, and initial planning.

    • Planning: Roadmaps, risk assessment, and governance.

    • Execution & Monitoring: Tracking progress and benefits realization.

    • Closure: Consolidating outcomes and transitioning deliverables to operations.


Benefits Management

  • Focus on achieving long-term value through effective tracking, analysis, and transitioning deliverables into operations.


Stakeholder Engagement

  • Active management of relationships and communication to align stakeholder needs with program objectives.

  • Tools include communication plans and risk identification strategies.


Governance

  • Establishes a framework to ensure programs align with organizational policies and maintain transparency.


Key Takeaways

  • Program management delivers strategic benefits beyond individual projects.

  • Involves a lifecycle approach from initiation to closure, with a focus on long-term outcomes.

  • Core skills include strategic thinking, leadership, risk management, and stakeholder alignment.


Summary of the Program Management Course Detailed

This course is divided into 4 stages. The first one is “what is Program Management”, the second one is the role of a program manager, the third stage is “Understanding Programs: Key Stages, Artifacts, Documents, Meetings, and Activities”, and the last one focus on the methodologies, benefits and challenges.


This lesson is structured in eight stages, each diving into key aspects of program management:


Introduction to Program Management: We’ll start by understanding what program management is, its importance, and how it differs from project management. This includes exploring the definition, key objectives and expected outcomes, along with its history and evolution.


Then, we will have the Key Functions and Responsibilities as a Program Manager: This section will examine the strategic role of a program manager, their essential competencies and critical responsibilities, such as strategic planning, stakeholder management, risk, and quality governance.


The Program Management Lifecycle: Here, we’ll cover the program management stages, from initiation to closure, along with important artifacts and documents like the program charter, benefits realization plan, and risk register.


Key Functions in Program Management: This part will emphasize strategic alignment, benefits management, resource allocation, and financial oversight, focusing on metrics that track program performance and impact.


Methodologies and Frameworks in Program Management: We’ll dive into common frameworks such as Managing Successful Programmes (MSP), Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), and hybrid models, along with essential tools for program oversight.


Challenges in Program Management: In this section, we’ll discuss challenges like cross-project dependencies, stakeholder expectations, scope creep, and solutions for communication breakdowns and resource constraints.


Advanced Program Management Techniques: This includes leadership approaches, adaptive communication, and ethical decision-making, along with case studies that highlight best practices in successful programs.


Program Management Benefits, Metrics, and Evaluation: We’ll conclude by discussing metrics for assessing program impact, long-term benefits realization, and continuous improvement for future programs.


Throughout these lessons, you will gain insights into the comprehensive scope of program management, its methodologies, and the skills required to ensure successful program outcomes.


This structure will reinforce the strategic importance of program management in achieving organizational goals.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in Project and Program Management

FAQ's

Why learn SQL?

  1. SQL is the most universal and commonly used database language. It powers the most commonly used database engines like PostgreSQL, SQL Server, SQLite, and MySQL. Simply put, If you want to access databases then yes, you need to know SQL.


  1. It is not really difficult to learn SQL. SQL is not a programming language, it’s a query language. The primary objective where SQL was created was to give the possibility to common people to get interesting data from the database. It is also an English-like language so anyone who can use English at a basic level can write SQL queries easily.


  1. SQL is one of the most sought-after skills by hiring employers.


  1. You can earn good money

How much time does it take to learn SQL?

SQL is easy but no one can determine the learning time it takes. It totally depends on you. The method we adopted to help you learn SQL quickly starts from the basics and takes you to advanced level within hours. You can follow the same, but remember you can learn nothing without practicing it. Practice is the only way to learn SQL quickly.

What are the steps I should follow to learn SQL?

  1. Start learning from the basics of SQL. The first 10 sections of the course cover the basics.

  2. Once done with the basic try your hands on advanced SQL. Next 10 sections cover Advanced topics

  3. Next few sections will cover help you with interviews and Vivas.

  4. Practice your learning on the exercise provided in every section.

What's the difference between SQL and PostgreSQL?

SQL is a language. Specifically, the "Structured Query Language"

PostgreSQL is one of several database systems, or RDMS (Relational Database Management System). PostgresSQL is one of several RDMS's, others of which are Oracle, Informix, MySQL, and MSQL.

All of these RDMSs use SQL as their language. Each of them have minor variations in the "dialect" of SQL that they use, but it's all still SQL.

Which is better, PostgreSQL or MySQL?

Both are excellent products with unique strengths, and the choice is often a matter of personal preference.

PostgreSQL offers overall features for traditional database applications, while MySQL focuses on faster performance for Web-based applications.

Open source development will bring more features to subsequent releases of both databases.

Who uses these databases?

Here are a few examples of companies that use PostgreSQL: Apple, BioPharm, Etsy, IMDB, Macworld, Debian, Fujitsu, Red Hat, Sun Microsystem, Cisco, Skype.

Course Author:

Dr. Alex Amoroso is a seasoned professional with a rich background in academia and industry, specializing in research methodologies, strategy formulation, and product development. In addition to her doctoral studies, Ms. Amoroso has served as an invited teacher, delivering courses on to wide range of students from undergraduate level to business students of professional and executives courses. In synergy between academical and business experience, Ms. Amoroso achieved high results in business career, leading R&D activities, product development, strategic development, market analysis activities in wide range of companies. Risk management is the process of identifying, assessing, and controlling potential threats to an organization. These threats, or risks, could stem from a wide variety of sources.


Here are the main focuses of risk management:

  • Identification: Finding potential risks that could affect your organization or project. This involves brainstorming, looking at past issues, and considering what might happen in the future.

  • Assessment: Determining the likelihood of those risks happening and how severe the impact would be if they did. This helps prioritize which risks need the most attention.

  • Control: Taking steps to reduce the likelihood of the risks happening or to minimize their impact if they do. This might involve things like putting safety procedures in place, buying insurance, or having backup plans.


Why is it important?

  • Minimizes losses: By identifying and managing risks, companies can reduce financial losses, protect their reputation, and avoid legal issues.

  • Improves decision-making: Risk management provides a framework for making informed decisions, considering potential downsides and opportunities.

  • Enhances resilience: It helps companies to be prepared for unexpected events and to bounce back quickly from setbacks.

  • Increases the likelihood of success: By addressing potential problems proactively, companies can increase their chances of achieving their goals.


For managers specifically:

  • Protects their team: Managers are responsible for the safety and well-being of their team. Risk management helps them create a safe work environment and minimize potential harm.

  • Builds trust: Employees trust managers who are prepared and take steps to protect them from risks.

  • Improves performance: When risks are managed effectively, employees can focus on their work without worrying about potential problems.


In uncertain world, risk management is more critical than ever. It's an essential skill for companies and managers who want to thrive in the face of challenges.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in business and risks

Why should you choose this course?

What makes us qualified to teach you?

The course is taught by Abhishek and Pukhraj. Instructors of the course have been teaching Data Science and Machine Learning for over a decade. They have an in-depth knowledge in advanced MS Excel and various data analysis tools available in the market.

Download Practice files, take Quizzes, and complete Assignments

What is covered in this course?

This course covers everything you need to crack advanced MS Excel in the professional work place.

Below are the Excel course contents of this complete and concise course on Microsoft Excel:

  • Introduction - In this video, the structure and contents of the course are discussed.

  • Mathematical Functions - This lecture covers Mathematical formulas such as SUM, AVERAGE,RAND, MIN & MAX, SUMPRODUCT.

  • Textual Formulas - This Excel lecture covers Textual formulas such as TRIM, CONCATENATE, SUBSTITUTE, UPPER & LOWER, LENGTH, LEFT, RIGHT & MID

  • Logical Formulas - This lecture covers Logical formulas such as AND & OR, IF, COUNTIF, SUMIF

  • Date-time (Temporal) Formulas - This lecture covers Date-time related functions such as TODAY & NOW, DAY, MONTH & YEAR, DATEDIF & DAYS

  • Lookup Formulas - This Excel lecture covers Lookup formulas such as VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, INDEX, MATCH

  • Data Tools - This lecture covers Data operating tools such as Data Sorting and Filtering, Data validation, Removing duplicates, Importing Data (Text-to-columns)

  • Formatting data and tables - This Excel lecture covers data formatting options such as coloring, changing font, alignments and table formatting options such as adding borders, having highlighted table headers, banded rows etc.

  • Pivot Tables - This Excel lecture covers Pivot tables end-to-end.

  • Charts - This Excel lecture covers charts such as, Bar/ Column chart, Line Chart, Scatter Plot, Pie & Doughnut charts, Statistical Chart - Histogram, Waterfall, Sparklines

  • Excel Shortcuts - This lecture will introduce you to some important shortcuts and teach you how to find out the shortcut for any particular excel operation.

  • Analytics in Excel - This Excel lecture covers the data analytics options available in Excel such as Regression, Solving linear programming problem (Minimization or Maximization problems), What-if (Goal Seek and Scenario Manager)

  • Macros - This lecture covers the process of recording a Macro, running a Macro and creating a button to run a Macro.

  • Bonus Lectures - Waterfall chart in Excel 2016 and previous versions of Excel, Infographics 1: Cool charts, Infographics 2: Cool charts

  • And so much more!

By the end of this course, your confidence in using MS Excel will soar. You will learn how Microsoft Excel can play a pivotal role in data analysis and related field. You'll also have a thorough understanding of how to use Microsoft Excel for study or as a career opportunity.

FAQ's

Why learn Microsoft Excel?

1. Microsoft Excel helps solve Business Problems

2. MS Excel has some extremely relevant and important data analysis tools.

3. Advanced MS Excel will give you an edge over other candidates in the competitive environment in schools, colleges or workplaces.

4. Microsoft Excel helps you get stuff done

5. Microsoft Excel will make you better at your job (no matter what that is)

6. Microsoft Excel know-how can instantly increase your job prospects as well as your starting salary

How much time does it take to learn Microsoft Excel?

Microsoft Excel is easy but no one can determine the learning time it takes. It totally depends on you. The method we adopted to help you learn Microsoft Excel quickly starts from the basics and takes you to advanced level within hours. You can follow the same, but remember you can learn nothing without practicing it. Practice is the only way to learn Microsoft Excel quickly.

What are the steps I should follow to learn Microsoft Excel?

1. Start learning from the basics of Microsoft Excel. The first 3 sections of the course cover the basics.

2. Once done with the basic try your hands on advanced MS Excel. Next 7 sections cover Advanced Excel topics

3. Next section will help you some cool new tricks of Microsoft Excel.

4. Practice your learning on the exercise provided with every lecture.

What is the difference between basic and advanced level of Excel?

At Basic level of MS Excel a person

  1. Can build excel formulas using: SUM, IF, AVERAGE, COUNT, ROUND

  2. Is comfortable building excel formulas to manipulate text and dates

  3. Understands and can use the Filter and Sort feature of Microsoft Excel.

  4. Can create basic charts like Line chart, bar chart and pie chart

At Advanced level of MS Excel a person

  1. Can implement Excel LOOKUP Formulas like VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, Index and Match

  2. Can use conditional and logical formulas like IF, SUMIF, COUNTIF, OR, AND etc.

  3. Knows what a Pivot Table is and how to build one.

  4. Knows what an add-in is and how to install one.

  5. Can record a macro and use it later.

  6. Can successfully edit/modify simple recorded macros.

  7. Can create advanced charts like Waterfall chart and overlay chart in Microsoft Excel

  8. Can create solve analytics problem using excel solver.

Start working proficiently on Microsoft Excel and increase your office productivity.

The Authors of this Microsoft Excel course have several years of corporate experience and hence have curated the course material keeping in mind the requirement of advanced MS Excel in today's corporate world.
targetAudiences: Anyone curious to master excel from beginner to Advanced in short span of time

courseDetails.title: Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos
courseDetails.shortDescription: Diploma Profissional em Metodologias de Investigação em Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos pelo MTF Institute
courseDetails.longDescription:
Bem-vindo ao Curso: Diploma Profissional em Metodologias de Investigação em Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos pelo MTF Institute


Curso ministrado pelo MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

O MTF é um instituto global de educação e investigação com sede em Lisboa, Portugal, focado na formação empresarial e profissional híbrida (presencial e online) nas áreas de: Negócios e Administração, Ciência e Tecnologia, Banca e Finanças.

O centro de I&D do MTF foca-se em atividades de investigação nas áreas de: Inteligência Artificial, Aprendizagem Automática ("Machine Learning"), Ciência de Dados, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Criptomoedas e Ativos Digitais, Metaversos, Transformação Digital, Fintech, Comércio Eletrónico, e Internet das Coisas.

O MTF é parceiro oficial da: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, membro da Câmara Portuguesa de Comércio e Indústria.

O MTF está presente em 208 países e foi escolhido por mais de 420 000 alunos.


Autora do Curso:

Alex Amoroso é uma profissional experiente com uma sólida formação académica e empresarial, especializada em metodologias de investigação, formulação de estratégias, e desenvolvimento de produtos. Doutorada pela Faculdade de Ciências Sociais e Políticas de Lisboa, Portugal, onde foi Aprovada com Distinção e Louvor pela sua investigação exemplar, Alex Amoroso traz consigo um vasto conhecimento e experiência.

Para além dos seus estudos de doutoramento, a Doutora Amoroso tem atuado como Professora Convidada, ministrando cursos a uma vasta gama de estudantes desde a licenciatura até alunos de cursos profissionais e executivos. Atualmente, na EIMT em Zurique, Suíça, leciona para doutorandos, oferecendo instrução avançada em desenho e metodologias de investigação. No Instituto MTF, a Doutora Amoroso lidera a área académica de Desenvolvimento de Produto.

Em sinergia entre a experiência académica e empresarial, a Doutora Amoroso alcançou elevados resultados na sua carreira profissional, liderando atividades de I&D, desenvolvimento de produtos, desenvolvimento estratégico, e análise de mercado num vasto leque de empresas. Implementou as melhores práticas de mercado em setores que vão da Banca e Finanças, ao PropTech, Consultoria e Investigação, e Startups Inovadoras.

A extensa produção científica de Alex Amoroso inclui numerosos artigos publicados em revistas conceituadas, bem como apresentações orais e posters em conferências internacionais. Os resultados da sua investigação têm sido apresentados em instituições de renome como a Faculdade de Ciências Políticas e Sociais e a Stressed Out Conference na UCL, entre outras.

Com uma paixão pela colaboração interdisciplinar e um compromisso em impulsionar mudanças positivas, Alex Amoroso dedica-se a capacitar alunos e profissionais para a utilização de metodologias de vanguarda para alcançar a excelência no mundo empresarial global.


Objetivos do Curso:

● Dotar-vos de conhecimentos e competências para uma eficaz tomada de decisão

● Enfatizar a inovação centrada no ser humano e o conhecimento executável

● Abordagem multidisciplinar para a inovação e desenvolvimento de produtos


O que são Metodologias de Investigação em Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos?

As metodologias de investigação em estratégia e desenvolvimento de produtos são as abordagens e ferramentas estruturadas utilizadas para recolher, analisar e interpretar informação que apoia planos estratégicos e a criação de produtos. Garantem que as decisões estão enraizadas em provas e nas necessidades dos clientes, e não em suposições.


Principais Focos das Metodologias de Investigação em Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos

● Estudo de Mercado: Compreender a dimensão, tendências, concorrência e oportunidades dentro de um mercado ou indústria específica.

● Investigação de Clientes: Investigar as necessidades, pontos problemáticos, comportamentos e preferências do seu público-alvo.

● Análise da Concorrência: Avaliar os pontos fortes, fracos, estratégias e quota de mercado dos concorrentes.

● Análise de Tendências: Identificar padrões emergentes, tecnologias, ou preferências dos clientes que possam moldar o futuro.

● Análise Interna: Analisar os pontos fortes, fraquezas, capacidades e recursos de uma empresa para informar a estratégia.

● Teste de Conceito de Produto: Recolher feedback sobre ideias de produtos propostas numa fase inicial do processo de desenvolvimento.

● Teste de Usabilidade: Avaliar se um produto é fácil e intuitivo de usar.
targetAudiences: Sem requisitos especiais. Um curso para qualquer pessoa que queira construir uma carreira em Estratégia e Desenvolvimento de Produtos

Below is a list of popular FAQs of students who want to start their Machine learning journey-

What is Machine Learning?

Machine Learning is a field of computer science which gives the computer the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed. It is a branch of artificial intelligence based on the idea that systems can learn from data, identify patterns and make decisions with minimal human intervention.

Which all classification techniques are taught in this course?

In this course we learn both parametric and non-parametric classification techniques. The primary focus will be on the following three techniques:

  1. Logistic Regression

  2. Linear Discriminant Analysis

  3. K - Nearest Neighbors (KNN)

How much time does it take to learn Classification techniques of machine learning?

Classification is easy but no one can determine the learning time it takes. It totally depends on you. The method we adopted to help you learn classification starts from the basics and takes you to advanced level within hours. You can follow the same, but remember you can learn nothing without practicing it. Practice is the only way to remember whatever you have learnt. Therefore, we have also provided you with another data set to work on as a separate project of classification.

What are the steps I should follow to be able to build a Machine Learning model?

You can divide your learning process into 3 parts:

Statistics and Probability - Implementing Machine learning techniques require basic knowledge of Statistics and probability concepts. Second section of the course covers this part.

Understanding of Machine learning - Fourth section helps you understand the terms and concepts associated with Machine learning and gives you the steps to be followed to build a machine learning model

Programming Experience - A significant part of machine learning is programming. Python and R clearly stand out to be the leaders in the recent days. Third section will help you set up the Python environment and teach you some basic operations. In later sections there is a video on how to implement each concept taught in theory lecture in Python

Understanding of  models - Fifth and sixth section cover Classification models and with each theory lecture comes a corresponding practical lecture where we actually run each query with you.

Why use R for Machine Learning?

Understanding R is one of the valuable skills needed for a career in Machine Learning. Below are some reasons why you should learn Machine learning in R

1. It’s a popular language for Machine Learning at top tech firms. Almost all of them hire data scientists who use R. Facebook, for example, uses R to do behavioral analysis with user post data. Google uses R to assess ad effectiveness and make economic forecasts. And by the way, it’s not just tech firms: R is in use at analysis and consulting firms, banks and other financial institutions, academic institutions and research labs, and pretty much everywhere else data needs analyzing and visualizing.

2. Learning the data science basics is arguably easier in R. R has a big advantage: it was designed specifically with data manipulation and analysis in mind.

3. Amazing packages that make your life easier. Because R was designed with statistical analysis in mind, it has a fantastic ecosystem of packages and other resources that are great for data science.

4. Robust, growing community of data scientists and statisticians. As the field of data science has exploded, R has exploded with it, becoming one of the fastest-growing languages in the world (as measured by StackOverflow). That means it’s easy to find answers to questions and community guidance as you work your way through projects in R.

5. Put another tool in your toolkit. No one language is going to be the right tool for every job. Adding R to your repertoire will make some projects easier – and of course, it’ll also make you a more flexible and marketable employee when you’re looking for jobs in data science.

What is the difference between Data Mining, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning?

Put simply, machine learning and data mining use the same algorithms and techniques as data mining, except the kinds of predictions vary. While data mining discovers previously unknown patterns and knowledge, machine learning reproduces known patterns and knowledge—and further automatically applies that information to data, decision-making, and actions.

Deep learning, on the other hand, uses advanced computing power and special types of neural networks and applies them to large amounts of data to learn, understand, and identify complicated patterns. Automatic language translation and medical diagnoses are examples of deep learning.

courseDetails.title: Scenario Planning Mastery: Visualizing Alternative Futures
courseDetails.shortDescription: Add a valuable strategic technique to your toolkit: Foreseeing how your future "business landscape" could change
courseDetails.longDescription:
The aim of this course is to help you visualize – and understand – alternative futures that could unfold for your business, project, product, industry - or entire country.

It is based on the course in scenario planning I teach in the Master's program in Future Foresight and Planning at Rochester Institute of Technology's Dubai campus – but with some extra content added which comes from my practical experience as a scenario generation workshop facilitator in over 30 countries, and from my bestselling books on this fascinating technique.

Why should you want to visualize your future? Because as a decision maker, you need to understand not just that the future will be different (we all know this), but how the future will be different – specifically, the future “business landscape” for your organization.

The reason this is so important is that you have to make decisions and plans today that will only play out at some point in the future – a future that right now is unknowable.  And even though we can't confidently predict exactly how the future is going to turn out, the success of your organization may depend on how good those decisions and plans are, how well-aligned they are with the way the future has actually unfolded.  Like it or not, though, you often have no choice but to make these decisions well before you know what the future terrain will in fact look like in which they will be implemented.

Scenario planning is a highly practical technique to foresee how this future business landscape could evolve – and potentially in different directions. It is not about predicting the future but exploring alternative futures – each of which could realistically emerge. Its practical value is clear: by helping you foresee different ways your particular market or business terrain could change, you're in a better position to make effective long-term plans today.

This Udemy course walks you step-by-step through the process of generating future scenarios for an organization, a product, an industry – even an entire country. The process is structured and logical, and yet very creative.

Join me for an eye-opening learning experience! I guarantee it will add a very valuable technique to your managerial toolkit.
targetAudiences: Anyone with (co-)responsibility for the future success of an organization of any kind
Strategy or planning professionals
Marketing professionals
Business owners, entrepreneurs, founders or investors in a start-up
Students of business or economics
